metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 14 axioms covering change of state, derived predicates, and movement on scales
metadata.notation: First-order logic with change relations and vertical scale concepts

axioms.title: Change argument constraints
axioms.english: The arguments of change are eventualities

axioms.title: Change involves common entity
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (change e1 e2) (exists (x)(and (arg* x e1)(arg* x e2)))))
axioms.english: A change of state is a change of state of something - the eventualities e1 and e2 have to involve some common entity x

axioms.title: Change is defeasibly transitive
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 e3) (if (and (change e1 e2)(change e2 e3)(etc)) (change e1 e3)))
axioms.english: Change is defeasibly transitive - if e1 changes into e2 and e2 changes into e3, then generally there is a change from e1 to e3

axioms.title: Change requires inconsistency or intermediate state
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (if (change' e e1 e2) (or (inconsistent e1 e2) (exists (e3 e4 e5 e6) (and (change' e4 e1 e3)(change' e5 e3 e2) (and' e6 e4 e5)(gen e6 e))))))
axioms.english: If the states are not inconsistent, then the change must be a composite of two changes through an inconsistent intermediate state

axioms.title: Change defeasibly implies inconsistency
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (if (and (change e1 e2) (etc)) (inconsistent e1 e2)))
axioms.english: Because change is not normally cyclic, we can defeasibly infer that start and end states are inconsistent

axioms.title: Definition of changeIn
axioms.fol: (forall (e x) (iff (changeIn' e x) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (arg* x e1)(arg* x e2)(change' e3 e1 e2)(gen e3 e)))))
axioms.english: There is a changeIn something when there is a change in its properties

axioms.title: Definition of changeFrom
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e3) (if (subst e3 e3 e1 e1) (iff (changeFrom' e e1) (exists (e2 e5) (and (change' e5 e1 e2)(gen e5 e)(inconsistent e3 e2))))))
axioms.english: changeFrom requires that after the change, no eventuality of the same type as the start state really exists

axioms.title: Definition of changeTo
axioms.fol: (forall (e e2 e4) (if (subst e4 e4 e2 e2) (iff (changeTo' e e2) (exists (e1 e5) (and (change' e5 e1 e2)(gen e5 e)(inconsistent e4 e1))))))
axioms.english: changeTo requires that the start state must exclude any other instance of the type which the end state instantiates

axioms.title: Definition of move
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (iff (move' e x y z) (exists (e1 e2 e3 s) (and (at' e1 x y s)(at' e2 x z s)(change' e3 e1 e2) (gen e3 e)))))
axioms.english: An entity x moves from y to z exactly when there is a change from x's being at y to its being at z

axioms.title: Nonnegative numeric scales are vertical
axioms.english: A nonnegative numeric scale is vertical

axioms.title: Vertical argument constraint
axioms.english: The argument of vertical has to be a scale

axioms.title: Definition of increase
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z s) (iff (increase x s) (exists (y z e1 e2) (and (at' e1 x y s)(at' e2 x z s)(lts y z s) (vertical s)(change e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If an entity moves from a point on vertical scale to a higher point, there has been an increase

axioms.title: Definition of decrease
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z s) (iff (decrease x s) (exists (y z e1 e2) (and (at' e1 x y s)(at' e2 x z s)(lts z y s) (vertical s)(change e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If an entity moves from a point on a vertical scale to a lower point, there has been a decrease

conversion_notes.fundamental_concept: Change is treated as a fundamental, undefinable concept in cognition
conversion_notes.eventuality_arguments: Change relates eventualities, not just entities - supports both types and tokens
conversion_notes.common_entity_requirement: Changes must involve a common entity to avoid unrelated state transitions
conversion_notes.defeasible_properties: Transitivity and inconsistency are defeasible to handle exceptions
conversion_notes.derived_predicates: changeFrom, changeTo, and move are derived from basic change predicate
conversion_notes.inconsistency_handling: Sophisticated treatment of when states are inconsistent vs. requiring intermediate states
conversion_notes.vertical_scales: Introduction of vertical metaphor for scales like numbers, probabilities, values
conversion_notes.increase_decrease: Movement up/down vertical scales provides increase/decrease concepts

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 14 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.foundation: Provides fundamental change concepts for temporal reasoning and process description
